title: Balance & Priorities
description: Discover how you support each other in finding balance.

questions.text: Right now, I'm trying to find better balance between...
choices: Time for us and time for myself

therapeutic.rationale: Balance challenges reveal current struggles. Work/life balancers need boundaries; us/me balancers need both connection and autonomy; responsibility/fun balancers need permission; ambition/contentment balancers need peace. Naming the challenge helps address it.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different balance challenges are individual. Understanding your partner's current struggle helps you support them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared balance challenges create opportunity for mutual support and growth.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What balance are you trying to find right now? How can your partner help?

questions.text: When life gets overwhelming, I tend to...

therapeutic.rationale: Overwhelm responses reveal coping patterns. Pushers power through; simplifiers reduce load; leaners seek support; reassessors find clarity. Knowing your partner's pattern helps you respond appropriately when they're stressed.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different overwhelm responses require flexibility. The pusher and the puller-back may not understand each other's approach.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched responses create understanding when you're both stressed.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you respond when life gets overwhelming? Is that approach serving you?

questions.text: My top priority in life right now is...
choices: Our relationship and building our future

therapeutic.rationale: Current priorities reveal focus areas. Relationship-prioritizers invest in partnership; career-prioritizers invest in work; health-prioritizers invest in wellbeing; happiness-prioritizers invest in fulfillment. Knowing priorities prevents misunderstanding about time allocation.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different priorities are normal and can coexist. Understanding your partner's current focus prevents resentment about time spent.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared priorities create aligned focus and mutual investment.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What's your top priority right now? Does your partner understand this?

questions.text: You help me maintain balance by...
choices: Helping me see what matters most
Being patient when I'm stretched thin

therapeutic.rationale: Partner balance support takes different forms. Break-reminders provide rest; priority-clarifiers provide perspective; load-lighteners provide relief; patient ones provide acceptance. Knowing how your partner helps you honors their contribution.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different types of support are all valuable. You each contribute unique gifts to each other's balance.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched appreciation shows you value similar support.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How does your partner help you maintain balance? Have you thanked them?

questions.text: Something I wish I made more time for is...

therapeutic.rationale: Time desires reveal what's missing. Quality-time seekers need more connection; self-care seekers need more rest; friend/family seekers need more relationships; hobby seekers need more enjoyment. Naming what you need helps create it.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different time desires point to different gaps. Both are valid and important to address.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared desires create clear direction for making time together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you wish you had more time for? What would it take to create that time?
